body.p: As a result of the standard‑by‑standard review, the IASB concluded that a current entry price and a current exit price will be equal when they relate to the same asset or liability on the same date in the same form in the same market. Therefore, the IASB considered it unnecessary to make a distinction between a current entry price and a current exit price in IFRSs with a market‑based measurement objective (ie fair value), and the IASB decided to retain the term fair value and define it as a current exit price.
